title: Wisdom or Meaning? Which Comes First? And Let's Just Not Reconstruct Postmodernism While We're at It
description:
Karen and Mark tackle the section of the "almost Psychedelic Conversation" from @ 2:02:00 to 2:16:30.  
Jordan Peterson and John Vervaeke
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DLg2Q0daphE&t=7444s

A play list of all ten episodes analyzing the almost psychedelic conversation: https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLoARw9zo4EUYEEhM_KIgzl_eW9ZZTHbzh

We discuss the 4 P's of knowing
The drive towards unity in the motivational hierarchy
Neo-Platonism
Religion is impossible, statistically speaking, and yet, here we are.
Predicrtion is hubris.
Sample bias and Hindsight bias
Plotinus - knowledge as a process of oneness
The body informs your limitations
Mark said, "Knowledge gives me the ability to cohere to the intelligibility past mere information", which I take to mean, knowledge helps me to align with Reality.
Information and Intelligibility
Principalities and Power
Critique rather than Deconstruction
Scientific truth and Religious truth

We will start next time with Heidegger, from the 2:16:30 mark or thereabouts:-)
